text: Edward Stanley (1790 – 19 August 1863) was a British Conservative and Tory politician. Stanley was elected Tory Member of Parliament for West Cumberland at the 1832 general election and, becoming a Conservative in 1834, held the seat until 1852 when he did not seek re-election. ==References== ==External links== * Category:UK MPs 1832–1835 Category:UK MPs 1835–1837 Category:UK MPs 1837–1841 Category:UK MPs 1847–1852 Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:Tory MPs (pre-1834) Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:1790 births Category:1863 deaths
title: Edward Stanley (1790–1863)
